newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX electricity settles lower, tumbles with cash.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX electricity settles lower, tumbles with cash.

text.p: NYMEX electricity futures ended the week lower, tumbling with weaker cash prices in the western U.S. due to ample hydroelectric supplies, forecasts of mild weather and plunging natural gas futures.

Peak, firm electricity prices for day-ahead delivery in the West fell sharply for a second day, down another $10.00 a megawatt hour (MWh) at the Palo Verde (PV) switchyard near Phoenix, Arizona, and the California-Oregon border (COB).
COB and PV next-day power prices for firm, peak delivery finished in the teens, about a third from the highs early this week when much of the western half of the country was hit with arctic cold.
Outlook of warmer weather across the U.S. next week also put downward pressure on natural gas prices.
NYMEX February Henry Hub gas futures settled down 8.4 cents at $3.257 cents per million British thermal units after reaching as low as $3.080.
February natgas deliveries to the San Juan/Blanco Hub fell to $2.85-$2.95 from Thursday's $3.00-$3.04.
February COB settled down 80 cents at $13.85/MWh, near a session low of $13.75 and not far from its contract low of $13.00. March COB finished down 55 cents at $11.80.
February PV settled down 99 cents at $16.00/MWh after bouncing between $15.90 and $16.25. March PV ended down 65 cents at $13.75.
Market participants expect the complex to continue this week's downward trend amid little supportive fundamental news and forecasts of mild weather out West.
"It's got room to go. You're going to see it pushed down," said a Houston futures trader.
In the Pacific Northwest, temperatures were forecast to average above normal into early next week, while precipitation would run near to above normal.
Down in the Southwest, sunny, dry weather would prevail this weekend with temperatures averaging five to 10 degrees Fahrenheit above normal by Sunday and early next week.
NYMEX estimated 273 COB and 135 PV contracts were sold.
